result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Fuchs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg. Sex Assault-Intoxicated Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(cm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $518  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Psychological evaluation and treatment as recommended.

May not use internet without agent's approval.  Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without agent's written permission.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MV.
Cognitive Thinking or Thinking for Change class. Sex Offender treatment as deemed appropriate.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Status conference on August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with M.M.V.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. tomorrow.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $20,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
